title: Northern Thrace
text:
Northern Thrace or North Thrace (, as opposed to <a href="Western%20Thrace">Western Thrace</a> and <a href="East%20Thrace">East Thrace</a> to the south; ; ), also called Bulgarian Thrace, constitutes the northern and largest part of the historical region of <a href="Thrace">Thrace</a>. It is located in <a href="Southern%20Bulgaria">Southern Bulgaria</a> and includes the territory south of the <a href="Balkan%20Mountains">Balkan Mountains</a> and east of the <a href="Mesta%20River">Mesta River</a>, bordering Greece and Turkey in the south and the <a href="Black%20Sea">Black Sea</a> in the east. It encompasses <a href="Sredna%20Gora">Sredna Gora</a>, the <a href="Upper%20Thracian%20Plain">Upper Thracian Plain</a> and 90% of the <a href="Rhodopes">Rhodopes</a>. The climate ranges from <a href="continental%20climate">continental</a> to transitional continental and mountainous. The highest temperature recorded in Bulgaria occurred here: it was at <a href="Sadovo">Sadovo</a> in 1916. The main rivers of the region are the <a href="Maritsa">Maritsa</a> and its tributaries. Notable cities include <a href="Plovdiv">Plovdiv</a>, <a href="Burgas">Burgas</a>, <a href="Stara%20Zagora">Stara Zagora</a>, <a href="Sliven">Sliven</a>, <a href="Haskovo">Haskovo</a>, <a href="Yambol">Yambol</a>, <a href="Pazardzhik">Pazardzhik</a>, <a href="Asenovgrad">Asenovgrad</a>, <a href="Kardzhali">Kardzhali</a>, <a href="Dimitrovgrad%2C%20Bulgaria">Dimitrovgrad</a>, <a href="Kazanlak">Kazanlak</a> and <a href="Smolyan">Smolyan</a>. Northern Thrace has an area of 42,073 km2.
The <a href="Ottoman%20Empire">Ottoman Empire</a> created the autonomous province of <a href="Eastern%20Rumelia">Eastern Rumelia</a> in Northern Thrace in 1878. The region was annexed by the <a href="Principality%20of%20Bulgaria">Principality of Bulgaria</a> in 1885.
Demographics.
The ethnic composition of the population of <a href="Eastern%20Rumelia">Eastern Rumelia</a>.
The population's ethnic composition in the <a href="Provinces%20of%20Bulgaria">Bulgarian provinces</a> of <a href="Burgas%20Province">Burgas</a>, <a href="Haskovo%20Province">Haskovo</a>, <a href="Kardzhali%20Province">Kardzhali</a>, <a href="Pazardzhik%20Province">Pazardzhik</a>, <a href="Plovdiv%20Province">Plovdiv</a>, <a href="Sliven%20Province">Sliven</a>, <a href="Smolyan%20Province">Smolyan</a>, <a href="Stara%20Zagora%20Province">Stara Zagora</a> and <a href="Yambol%20Province">Yambol</a>.
